Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: simon j
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, very well look after on the inside and a good breakfast, which is served 7:30-11am, of croissants, fruit in juice/syrup, honey, jams, juices, milk, pastries the list goes on. Very pleasant staff, always smiling. There was also a laptop downstairs and free Wi-Fi if you have an internet phone. You also have a TV, mini bar and can have breakfast brought to you if you ask, free of charge. The hotel is also just a few minutes from the waterfront and a few hundred meters from St Mark's Square. All in all a very good hotel, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gem2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 2 night stay weekend. Superb location.. Only a few minutes walk from san marco square and slightly further to the rialto, but a lovely walk through the winding streets. Bars and restaurants on the hotels doorstep. Hotel is lovely, lovely reception & nice breakfast included. Our room was nice just felt tht the bathroom was tired for a 'superior' room. Shower was a wate of time. Lovely view onto canal though. Reasonable minibar in room and sat tv although no english channels. All in all a nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “We were delighted with our stay at the Priuli!”
Reviews.Author: Marco S
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay at the Priuli, and look forward to staying there again when we return to Venice. The staff was always friendly and helpful, including arranging for a visit by a physician, who arrived promptly and solved our problem. Breakfast was elegant and satisfying, the rooms were comfortable, clean, warm (we visited over New Year's) and well furnished. Best of all was the location, close to everything, including a public laundry, splendid restaurants, both expensive and reasonable, and easy access to all transportation. Staff was always reliable for good advice on what to see and how to get there. Definitely a find! ps as a gay couple, we felt very comfortable throughout our stay. DMS

Reviews.Title: “Elegance with history”
Reviews.Author: Fredric W
Reviews.Content: We had a suite at the Palazzo, which has a history going back to a Hungarian ambassador to the then-powerful Venetian state nearly 500 years ago. It had all the charm of a historic building with excellent amenities. Very comfortable, a view of gondolas just outside the window.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Affordable Convenient”
Reviews.Author: j-and-i-inGermany
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very pleased with our stay at Palazzo Priuli. Our room was attractive, comfortable, well-equipped, quiet, and -- important in late November -- well-heated. The hotel is very near -- but not in -- areas with numerous restaurants, shops, services and tourist attractions. There is no lift. We would not recommend the Palazzo Priuli to people who have difficulty with steps, and we also would not recommend it to persons travelling with small children or who wish to have luxurious accommodation. It is important to keep in mind that the Palazzo Priuli is a small hotel and the rooms differ in size and comfort. We had booked a "superior room", we were travelling "out-of season" and we were very pleased with the accommodation we had. Persons booking a standard room or a room at the Casa Priuli might not benefit from the same level of comfort. The location of the Palazzo Priuli suited us perfectly. We have often been to Venice, and on this occasion we wanted to visit the Biennale which is concentrated in the Eastern portion of Venice. Persons visiting Venice for just a day or two and traveling by car or train might prefer to stay somewhat nearer to Piazzale Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Four nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: andrew f
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from four wonderful days and nights in Venice (25 - 29 Nov 2011). We stayed in Palazzo Priulli, in the junior suite. It was wonderful; a lovely large room, canal views, original historic furniture and a lovely clean bathroom. The hotel staff were superb (we speak a little Italian which I think they appreciated) and couldn't do enough for us. They even organised for us to have a private water taxi to the Island of Murano with a guided tour of a glass factory too - all free, (I think the factory would have liked us to buy a a chandelier but they had to make do with my wife buying a glass bead bracelet instead!!). It was a very clean hotel and the breakfast was excellent. In the afternoon they lay on nibbles, soft drinks and prosecco - all courtesy of the hotel. It was easy to find and only 3 mins walk from san Zaccaria Vaporetto stop and 5 mins from St Marks Square. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, plus, if you pay cash on departure, they give you an extra 10% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Real Venetian hospitality”
Reviews.Author: anon186275
Reviews.Content: My husband and I know Venice very well, and, over the years, have stayed in both apartments and various hotels The Palazzo Priuli and its annexes, Ca' Priuli and Casa Nicolo Priuli, are all decorated in traditional Venetian style. The Palazzo's interior is in the style of Renaissance period and guests are treated to various reproductions of works by Renaissance artists, for example, Vittore Carpaccio, adorning the walls of both rooms and public areas. These are complemented by traditional Venetian furnishings. The style of Casa Nicolo Priuli, which is a converted Venetian residence a few steps away along the canal, is more 18th-19th century, but again a traditional feel It is our experience that the management is most professional and helpful and all the staff offer a very kind and friendly service. All were extremely courteous The rooms are very clean and housekeeping is of a very high standard. The location is ideal as one can explore northwards into Castello, away from the main tourist areas and into the 'real Venice', similarly St Mark's is a 5 minute walk away and then one can walk southwards and explore the Dorsoduro. For genuine and friendly Venetian hospitality (as opposed to the glitz of some hotels that you can find in any city), this, in our opinion, is a 'must'. We shall not hesitate to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely!”
Reviews.Author: SherryFrumkin
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered our room and opened the window, we knew we had chosen the perfect place for our stay in Venice. A light breeze carried the resonant tones of a tenor singing a beautiful aria as he paddled just below. That and a great, quiet location, perfect for visiting the Biennale, the helpful staff and an absolutely delicious, small restaurant owned by the hotel and tucked behind it on a sweet little street, made this a perfectly lovely experience. The restaurant is called Luna Sentada. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Priuli - great hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Deborah P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located near the Grand Canal and St Marks and is a genuine former palazzo, set beside a canal. We found the staff extremely helpful and cheerful (contrary to a former review) but best of all, nothing was too much trouble for them. They were also very unobtrusive. They very kindly upgraded our room on my husband's birthday and provided a bottle of prosecco for the occasion - a nice touch! But soft drinks and prosecco and nibbles are also provided during the afternoon for you to help yourself to - another nice touch after a hard day's site seeing in Venice. Bedrooms are good size, very clean and well furnished, complete with glass chandeliers and there was a hairdryer in the bathroom (with a lovely bath as well as shower). This was our second trip to Venice and we enjoyed it all the more for our stay in Palazzo Priuli.

Reviews.Title: “This is where we'll stay when we return to Venice!”
Reviews.Author: ABlueOtter
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two locations on the same block. We stayed at the second location, not where the main lobby or dining room is. We are a family of 4 with two tall teenagers. The room was GREAT. Plenty of space, hardwood floors, very comfortable beds -- with two proper single beds for our kids, (not fold outs or rollaways). Decor is old world Venice, but not dusty or damp in any way. Clean and attractive. Bathroom was very nice. Not luxurious, but nice. GET THE BREAKFAST here. It was the best we had on our trip. I was a little disappointed that we did not get to eat in the beautiful dining room I had seen online. When you stay in the second location you get BIGGER rooms, but eat in a small cafe area. However, the small cafe area was just fine, and the coffee was awesome, with lots of hot milk, and there were lots of items to choose from. Everything was help yourself and have as much as you like. The best part of all was the LOCATION. I loved how this was a short walk to St. Mark's Square, and there were lots of charming alleyways full of little shops and restaurants. Staying at this location really made Venice our favorite part of our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel was Amazing, the front desk needs a Happy Pill”
Reviews.Author: midlifecrsis
Reviews.Content: The location of a Palazzo Priuli is about a 5 minute walk from St. Markâ€™s. It puts you close to everything you want to see while at the same time avoiding the masses. This made for a quiet night after a full day of walking all over Venezia. Once you head up the stairs to your room, it is clear how much history the Palazzo Priuli has. The Stairs and stone floors are uneven with frequent slopes in elevation. This adds to the authenticity of the Palace. The ceiling displays the wood beam construction method used in the period. The dÃ©cor also gives the impression that you have stepped back in time 600 years and you are staying as a guest with the Priuli family in their Palace. There is a strange smell everywhere in the building, perhaps from the age. It was not offensive, just strange. We stayed in the first suite right up the stairs that is listed as a Quad. When we checked in, they had two other beds made up in front of the fire place. The bed felt as though it came out of the 16th century. It was as hard as stone. The lobby staff was pleasant but they didnâ€™t put much effort into going beyond pleasant. The breakfast staff and bell hop put much more effort into ensuring absolute satisfaction. If you are looking for a Quad room in Venice, the Palazzo Priuli will do the job. It is hard to find Quad rooms in Venice so if I needed a Quad room, I might book it again. However, if I just needed a room for two I would probably check out some of the other places.

Reviews.Title: “a good location, but..........”
Reviews.Author: ecclesyale Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: a bad start,they did not have our reservation nor a vacant room. the reception staff were good and found alternative accomodation for the first night. they realised an error had been made( by whom?) and moved our luggage back into an "upgraded" room for our last two nights. the room was large but gloomy with heavy dark brown furniture and paint work, dark drapes and heavy nets. the modern bathroom was fine. an average breakfast in a dreary and cramped dining area. the hotel was well situated and an interesting historical building but not worthy of 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel, absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Kathy_onhols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011, and had the best time. The hotel is breathtakingly beautiful, large lovely luxurious rooms, stunning dining room, views of canal from most windows. Staff were super friendly and organised a gondola to come to the door of the hotel, with a bottle of champagne for a 30 minutes tour, very nice. Everyday there was a lovely afternoon tea served for FREE! Afternoon tea consisted of nuts, cookies, juice, softdrinks and red/white wine and champagne on ice. The hotel was very quite and relaxing with traditional Venician decor, including spectacular glass chandeliers. The location was perfect, a block or so back from the very busy Grand Canal, located right near laneway after laneway of gorgeous shops! Lots of restaurants within an easy 3 minutes walk. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware...This Hotel's Website is NOT what it really looks like”
Reviews.Author: jacksondlz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a FABULOUS trip to the Mediterranean. As a special occaision, we spent extra time in Venice. Our travel agent booked us at this hotel and our travel agent was excellent, however, he didn't really have personal knowledge of this hotel. Not only were we royally fleeced by this hotel, our room was a grim, dingy closet. We found out later that we could have stayed at the Gritti Palace or the Danieli for what we paid for this place. Our room had no air conditioning and when we complained, nicely, we were told that the air was out throughout the hotel and we were the "first to complain"! Come again...I grew up in a family-owned air conditioning contractor business so I knew this was a lie. When we asked that our room rate be cut in half for no air, they "magically" found us a room with air conditioning! The other thing they don't tell you is that the hotel is in three different buildings; one with no lobby (they tried to stick us here, first). All in all the hotel is substandard and the same price as the Gritte Palace or the Danieli. We DEFINITELY do NOT recommend this hotel for non-Italian speaking Americans. But our hotel did not ruin our trip to Venice. Venice is not to be missed and enchanting as a you could possibly imagine!

Reviews.Title: “A trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: Ask-the-cat
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the location are absolutely ideal to explore the city! Close to the most important sights but far away to have a quiet night. The breakfast is very good- quality and variety are fine. Even more important is the staff- all of them were very friendly, helpful and customer focused. The interior is as charming as the exterior. If one likes antiques this is the place to be. The only improvement we suggest is to get new better mattresses. We would always come back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect.”
Reviews.Author: KandDthinkthis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this lovely historic hotel for 3 nights in December 2010. Our room and our experience at this hotel was perfect. All of the staff we made contact with were very welcoming, friendly and courteous. The housekeeping staff was particularly observant and helpful. We chose this hotel primarily because it is in an old building, and the unique beauty of the building wowed us the whole time we were there. The very worn stone steps that lead to the second floor make you think of all the people and all the years the beautiful home has seen. The building's location is very easy to find, yet it feels tucked away and private in a city that crawls with tourists. The breakfast was delicious and hearty, and the breakfast room with it's glittering Murano chandelier and tall, tall windows overlooking a canal is unforgettable. The quality of the breakfasts at this Hotel have made my breakfasts at home, well, pale in comparison. We will assuredly stay here the next time we are lucky enough to be in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, No Sleep”
Reviews.Author: Odoric
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years ago. It was so bad I actually decided to look it up and see if things had improved - apparently not. Our room was on the first floor where the dining room is located. We were woken very early every morning as staff prepared breakfast (a selection of cheap cheese, ham, hard boiled eggs etc.) At night, for reasons I couldn't figure out, the room was sweltering. We asked to turn on the air-con, but the ever unhelpful staff basically said tough. Therefore we had to keep our windows wide open. As the hotel is located on a busy street this meant lots and lots of noise (mostly shouting) well into the early hours of the morning. We weren't able to sleep for more than a couple of hours so we asked to change rooms - but were told this was not possible. At each request it the staff clearly couldn't have cared less. We left after the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and rare quality of standards in hotellerie in Venice”
Reviews.Author: debfrance
Reviews.Content: I'm serious about the review title - this is an exceptional hotel in it's class (and can easily hold it's own in standards of quality/professionalism with many of the four-starred venetian hotels). Privately-owned, "traditional venetianpalazzo/manor house" hotel run to high standards, meaning that the attention to detail is taken to heart. We appreciate such attention to detail: authentic and/or high standard of architecture/decor, comfort and cleanliness: comfortable and well-appointed rooms, no matter which type of room; professional staff: attentive and efficient at the reception; attentive, efficient and hospital breakfast room staff; excellent housekeeping. Quality/price ratio is very, very good. Book directly through their website (google search "Palazzo Priuli". Don't despair if rooms aren't available for your dates - also check out their "Ca'Priuli" and "Casa Nicolo Priuli", just next door. Same standards, but in smaller buildings (and the prices are lower). I'm sitting here, in the breakfast room at the time of this writing - acqua alta is just now descending, but rather than put on my rubber boots and go outside, I'm just as happy sitting inside, high and dry, while enjoying the ambience of the Priuli. Over the past 8-9 years, I've stayed here numerous times and in various rooms, liking them all (family rooms, small intimate deluxe/superior rooms, big rooms), and it is always a pleasure to come back to this hotel (and to Venice, of course...). I can compare it with at least 20 other hotels, bed and breakfast and apartments, each with their own particular charms, but for overall standards, and in it's class, the Palazzo Priuli is outstanding in our estimation. Hope this helps in your researching Venice hotels. I am someone who loves to come here, and I've become a bit demanding when it comes to where I/we stay. After all this time I am writing my first review of a hotel, as it is only fair that I publicly render hommage to the fine management and staff of this hotel, as well as the beautiful building itself!

Reviews.Title: “OK but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: magpie172
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. It's close to the major attractions but far enough away that you are not overwhelmed by crowds. The room was small but reasonably comfortable. First night I asked for a second pillow. The man from the front desk appeared with a pillow in one hand & a pillow case in the other. They offer a sort of nondescipt breakfast ;they really need to work on that. They said they had free Wi-Fi but non of the guests could get it to work.

Reviews.Title: “extremely rude and impolite staff”
Reviews.Author: ELA81
Reviews.Content: It's a terrible hotel, just the building itself is beautiful, other than that it has no other values. Extremely rude and impolite staff, we have never seen such thing any where. The rooms are not good, beds are awful, and breakfast is very bad. I don't recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: wjak58
Reviews.Content: The positives: great location, historic building with lots of character, very helpful service from front desk personnel, free internet access, nice bathroom The negatives: uncomfortable beds, below average breakfast, computer system issue that affected our reservation (they lost our reservation for the first night of our stay, and had to put us in a nearby hotel. They handled the transferring of our luggage, but it was stressful and inconvenient).

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in a perfect location with with lots of charm!”
Reviews.Author: cw001
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice for Carnivale and had an amazing time. The hotel was perfect for our trip. It is in a fantastic location - for both San Marco and Rialto Bridge as well as easy access to the water boats. The room (for 4) was very spacious and clean. The staff in the hotel were always friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, not amazing but fine enough. For the time of year we got quite a good deal. Yes it was fairly expensive but hey, most things are in Venice. Don't go if you're on a budget!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing. Bad Service and Attitudes.”
Reviews.Author: forrestbug
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3 people with a canal view and paid in advance. I was traveling with my mother and brother. It was the first vacation for my mother in over 5 years and she was very excited to stay at this hotel. It was also quite expensive. We were in Florence for 3 days before arriving in Venice and my brother got very ill. We had to go to the hospital two times. I called the hotel and spoke to the manager. I told them that my brother was sick and we were considering staying an extra day in Florence so that he could rest. I asked if we would have to pay for the first night if we arrived on the second reserved night instead, and they said yes. We decided to stay in Florence anyway and I sent them an email letting them know we would arrive a day late. We arrived after a long day of travel. It turned out to be a holiday and it took us two hours to get to the hotel from the train station. Tired, hot and sweaty we finally arrived. They told us they gave away our prepaid room and canceled our reservation since we didn't arrive the day before. They were not very nice about it, and after insisting they found us a room in another hotel that was not the class or caliber of hotel that we paid for. They informed us that we were lucky to get a room at all since it was a holiday in Venice. The whole time they acted like it was our fault, and when we asked to speak to a manager they told us he was out for the day and we would have to speak to him another time. The next day they did move us back into the hotel that we had booked and did give us a nice room. But by that time we were already disappointed. When I talked to the manager he claimed to have no knowledge of our conversation and again acted like it was our fault. I pulled up the emails I sent him and he finally admitted to remembering. He complimented my Italian language skills, saying I wrote better than most of the people that grew up there, but still did not apologize. He also refused to give us a discount for the cheaper hotel we were put up in the night we arrived. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but not worth 4 Stars”
Reviews.Author: Travel26
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the New Year period and were a little dissapointed at the standards. Although it's only a few minutes walk from the main attractions it's in a nice quiet area. Be careful of the annexe in this hotel as it appears to be the top 2 floors of a private block of flats and the light shining through the door kept us awake so we asked to be moved to another room. The new room was much better and the hotel staff were generally friendly and helpful. Breakfast was taken in the main hotel which was ok but for a 4 star hotel you'd be forgiven for expecting a little more although service was again very good. If you've got the money you could do much worse than go for a trip with the singing gondalier who waits on the bridge near the hotel for customers, the gondola is right outside the annexe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMikey
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I have stayed at. We got a great deal through a website which made it unbelievable value, especially for venice. The hotel has a great atmosphere. It really makes Venice extra-special when you can stay at a quality place like this hotel. A general tip for Venice - wherever you stay don't skimp on the accommodation, it can make a huge difference to your appreciation of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Venice ticks all the boxes for a perfect mini break (except for the locals)”
Reviews.Author: Renardmeister
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellently located overlooking a canal and a short distance to St Marks etc. Stayed in a deluxe canal side room that was well appointed, very quiet at night and cool thanks to the A/C. The staff are pleasant and efficient. Took my wife here for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we both had a wonderful time. The weather was perfect and the crowds (it was bank holiday weekend) as expected. On a sunny day, the whole place shimmers with a special quality unique to its watery surroundings. The only negative is the locals, especially those running the restaurants, they all seem so miserable and uninterested. Plus, the younger gondaliers are ruining the traditional gondola image with cigarettes in hand and mobile phones glued to their ears. To me, it all suggests complacency - why bother if the conveyor belt bringing tourists never seems to end. My recommendation is visit some of the other islands by waterbus, they are quieter and you get a more friendly welcome. I was here 30 years ago and will come back again, but probably out of season when I hopefully will not be taken for granted.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: WellingtonKiwiJo
Reviews.Content: We wanted accommodation that was truly Venetian and Palazzo Priuli fitted the bill perfectly. Our room had a high timbered ceiling, rich drapery, very generous bathroom and windows that overlooked the canal and passing gondalas. The breakfast room was spacious and breakfast quality excellent. It's true that the staff aren't effervescent but they were genuinely helpful when requested and assisted in booking Vivaldi concert tickets which was a wonderful thing to do. Although not cheap, I felt the price we paid in high season represented good value for money and we loved the charm and history associated with the hotel. Where this hotel really wins is in terms of location - it's just a few minutes from San Marco but we felt miles away from the heaving daytime crowds. Get off at Vaporetto St Marks/San Zaccaria and then there's just two sets of steps to haul luggage over before getting to the hotel. It's also a good vaporetto stop for getting to or from the airport. I'd absolutely stay here again and only hope that I get to go back to Venice sometime soon to do so!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: nyfamily5
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay, we thought the location was great and the room was very comfortable. We got a kick out of the crooked steps, but that added to the charm of the place. The staff was very helpful, my husband had a problem with a bank card and the staff at the hotel was extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Also, the free wireless internet was nice to have! This hotel has a very European feel!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet elegance”
Reviews.Author: barone8
Reviews.Content: I really liked this former palace of a renowned Venetian family. This is a hotel for those who want to stay in an almost immediate vicinity of San Marco, but don't like the bustling tourist crowds. It is a VERY quiet place indeed - inside and outside and it is not overloaden with fake artefacts like many other hotels of this class. An old furniture is comfortable enough and an uneven floors in rooms and staircases give an idea of how people built in those ancient times. There are only 3 min. walk from vaporetto stop San Zaccaria-San Marco and some 5 min. to Piazza San Marco. What else do one need?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mariusztk
Reviews.Content: A splendid 14th century palace of the noble Priuli family (which has delivered three doges and many more officials). A gem of the Venetian gothic, featured in the popular DK tourist guide series. Perfect location, near the San Marco, yet away from the hustle and bustle. Nice and very friendly staff, nice rooms with old furniture, very pleasant and private atmosphere. Breakfast included, served in a splendid room. A very cosy and private place (the hotel occupies only a part of the palace). Located on a canal in the quiet Castello district (whiich I recommend to tour in order to see the life of native Venetians). Nearby you will find something which is really rare in Venice - a small gourmet restaurant, whose imaginative chef creates superb dishes (don't expect pizza there, various kind of fish rule the menu). The level of service in unsurpassed, the food simply delicious and the Italian wines very well chosen. But do not forget to book a table for the evening. The restaurant is called il Ridotto, and located just on the way from the hotel to Piazza San Marco, in the Campo SS. Filippo e Giacomo. The restaurant owner runs a trattoria nearby (actually opposite) which is called Aciughetta (the food is very nice ther, too).

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic, Great Location, Great Rooms,”
Reviews.Author: Austo
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a perfect laction 10-15 minutes walk from St Marks Square, but far enough out not to feel swamped by tourists! It was a beautiful hotel, we had one of the suites and the deco, furniture and all round facilities were excellent. A beautiful large room with antique furniture made our stay amazing. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL BUILDING BUT NO ATMOSPHERE”
Reviews.Author: GARFEY
Reviews.Content: The personal service was very sparce. giovanna matteo and lady were friendly and helpful, however the rest of thestaff were unhelpful . On the day of departure no offer of help was given to get our suitcases to the water taxi just directions. A very beautiful hotel but we were made to feel that we were intruding. I

Reviews.Title: “Location and luxury - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Seren3
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from Piazza San Marco but a million miles from the thronging crowd, the Palazzo Priuli is a glorious hidden gem. As we walked up from the airport waterbus my husband pointed out a building with beautiful windows. "I think that's our hotel" I said in wonder, and it was. I'd been a little concerned that the Palazzo Priuli would not live up to its gorgeous website, especially as I found no mention of it in any guidebook I studied, but I needn't have feared. It was everything we could have hoped for and more. Our room was spacious, with a large comfortable bed and a view over a quiet canal. The bottle of sparkling wine in our room was a nice touch and the attention to detail was great - one morning a bulb in my bedside light went, and the next time we came back to the room it had been replaced. The staff were friendly and polite and always seemed to be smiling. I have already recommended the hotel to family, friends and colleagues and if we ever went back to Venice we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel--superb location, beautiful interior, large room”
Reviews.Author: mlv123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building--literally on a canal. We walked 10 steps out the door and took a gondola ride that brought us back to the front entrance of the hotel. We were short walks away from San Marco square, the Doge's palace, Rialto Bridge, and Florian's bar where Ernest Hemingway would imbibe when in town (and where I bought the most expensive drink in my life!) The breakfast was first-rate continental: coffee, teas, juices, cereals, fruits, hard rolls & sweet rolls, tortes, cold cuts & cheeses, and some fresh veggies; very filling. We arrived late & in the rain. They had put everything away, but set up again just for us; nice touch. Our room was large and on the canal--in the afternoon, we would lean out the window & wave to the gondola riders below while listening to the accordion and singing of the gondoliers. The bathroom was also larger than expected and very clean. The staff was friendly, coached me on some Italian phrases, and gave good directions (essential in a place with streets as convoluted as Venice!). A wonderful experience for me and my wife. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellinon46
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at Palazzo Priuli, loved the classically Venetian decor and our room was spacious and really large bathroom both spotlessly clean. Breakfast had a great selection of food and we liked the slanted staircase up to the breakfast room. The reception staff were really friendly and so welcoming gave us excellent restaurant tips for authentic top Venetian food. Also organised a free trip out to Murano and visit to glass factory for us. The hotel is an excellent location and relatively easy to find although everyone has fun finding their way around Venice. We loved the hotel and was a welcome relief to get back to as we were in Venice over a weekend and days either side and several large cruise ships were in and it was very very crowded on the weekend. Would definitely stay at the Palazzo Priuli again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Rheasun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Palazzo Priuli. Room 107 overlooking the canal, a quad room. Spacious and so peaceful. Just now read previous positive reviews and feel what else can i add? We were so happy with the hotel. Sisters on a reunion break. it's location is so close to San Marco yet away from the crowds. Shops abound. Front desk staff so friendly and spoke perfect English. Breakfast was lovely and wonderfully filling. Afternoon snacks of fruit, crackers, soft drinks a nice touch, as no bar facility. No tea making facility in the room but could be requested of the staff. But not late at night(11pm). Loved having free internet access on a laptop in the lobby! They organised a water taxi for 4 of us for 105euro and it was so exciting, well worth the expense, only took 20minutes to Marco Polo airport. a Happy Dubliner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DDKU
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd and final hotel that my wife and I stayed at during our 10 year anniversary tour of Italy. After having 2 great experiences in hotels in Florence and Rome, our expectations were extremely high. Needless to say, we were blown away. Our room was in the small annex next to the hotel lobby. I was a little worried at first, but when the door opened we were in heaven. The room looked brand new! Very nicely appointed and actually very spacious by European standards. Flat screen TV on the wall, dimming lights and a GORGEOUS 2 PERSON DOUBLE-HEADED SHOWER!! Our room had a window that looked right out over a small canal that had 2 gondolas parked outside. We hired Tony to take us for a ride and it was wonderful. He was a fantastic 3rd generation gondolera. My wife was estatic and the hotel set the tempo for a romantic and wonderful time in Venice. The walk to the hotel from the vaporetto dropoff was very shot and extremely easy. Breakfast is served in beautiful dining room overlooking a small canal and is the traditional Italian hotel breakfast. Very simple and tasty and a nice way to start the day. While in Venice make sure to eat plenty of Cichetti and the small mayo sandwiches called Tremanzani. We loved the shrimp salad and hard-boiled egg washed down with a Lowenbrau.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pmmcTO
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a four night stay at the Palazzo Priuli and we had a great time!! The hotel is very conveniently located, it was easy to access from the vaporetto stop and a short distance from Piazza San Marco, but it was nicely set in a quiet area away from the crowds. There was a gondola route on the canal beside the Palazzo, so you could often hear accordians and singing in the afternoon. It was very peaceful in the evenings. The room was beautiful, with gorgeous high ceilings, a very comfortable bed, and it had a large modern bathroom. It was spotlessly clean! Front desk staff members were great - all knowledgeable and spoke perfect English so there was never a language barrier for us. I believe they also spoke French. The breakfast buffet was wonderful - everything you could want, and it was included in the price. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TGS-DALLAS
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Palazzo Priuli, and it didn't disappoint. The room, while small (of course) was well appointed, and the staff is always eager to help. The breakfast is very good, although I wish the coffee selection was better. As far as location goes, It is the reason we keep going back. Palazzo Priuli is located about only 5 minutes from St. Mark's, but it feels much further away from the crowds then that. After a couple of minutes walk, there is almost no crowd, and when coming back at night it is almost completely deserted. You really get a much more authentic Venice feel here than you do with the hotels closer to St. Mark's or the Rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, but”
Reviews.Author: MrsSH2008
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very pleasant stay at the hotel. The location is fantastic, just a few minutes walk to the Piazza San Marco where you can jump on the water taxis, or stroll for a few more minutes to San Marco square. The hotel staff have excellent knowledge and will give you any travel advice. The rooms are large and traditionally furnished. We had room 104 and the only complaint was that it was next to the breakfast kitchen, so at 7am you were awakened by the noise of clinking crockery, the microwave ping, and the dishwasher!! The room also overlooked the side canal, this was great when the gondolas were passing with music from accordions and the singing gondolier, the downside was that the building opposite was undergoing restoration, so if you are there during the week the workmen start at 8am, but they did not work at the weekend. Do not be put off by this review I would certainly go back again but request a room other than 104 The breakfast was more than adequate with fruit juices, cereals, ham, cheese, yoghurt, toast, eggs, croissants and local cakes plus a large display of fresh fruit. From the airport you can take the Alilaguna water bus to San Zaccaria for 12 euro and the hotel is just 200m away through a small street at the side of Pagnelli Hotel into a church square, turn left and then cross the small bridge to the entrance of the hotel. Alternatively if your journey is a special occassion you can take the water taxi from the airport to the hotel's own canal dock. The hotel arranged this for us at a cost of 105 euro, which had to be paid in cash at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Vesimies
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband and our daughter in Ca' Priuli and Casa Nicolo Priuli (which are the part of Palazzo Priuli) for 3 nights in March 2008. We wanted a good location and that we got for sure. The hotel is perfectly located. We had booked a triple room but we did not get that room for the first night. So, we had to change the room after one night which is very inconvenient for the family travelling with kid. There was no water coming at all on the first morning, so we could not wash ourselves or use the toilet. The rooms were luckily warm. The next two nights we stayed in the same room but on the second evening there was only ice cold water coming from the tub and this was the case also on the morning we checked out the hotel. We complained and the hotel offered the access to the bathroom in the Palazzo Priuli. However, it is not very convenient to leave the room early in the morning and get to the building next door for the shower. We were supposed to pay 682 euros for 3 nights but after demanding the discount we paid 15% less. Taken into account that we are talking about 4-star hotel we were very disapponted with the facilities and especially the service which was unfriendly. When we checked out the hotel a receptionist did not even apologise for the inconveniences. I am not going to choose this hotel next time I go to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flynnic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and her mother and father stayed at the Pallazo (not to be mistaken with the Casa Priuli which is next door) from 15 to 18 of March 2008. First of all the cost of the hotel was â‚¬600 for two deluxe rooms for four people for two nights which worked out at â‚¬75 per person per night which, when you consider that its Venice, we thought was excellent value, the hotel itself is a former palace hence the name and it certainly is a beautiful hotel...rooms are spacious beautifully decorated with period furniture yet with a really modern but tasteful bathroom...al the usual stuff...bath, shower, bidet, etc...we had a canal view which was really nice at night or first thing in the morning...its about 5 minutes walk from San Marco Square and the main promenade. It was really nice and quiet both day and night ( probably down to time of year)..it was a balmy 18 degrees celcius while we were there.. t-shirts were worn...breakfast at the hotel, staff, rooms, service and staff all made for a memorable stay. We got a water taxi (â‚¬90) from the airport (one-way) direct to the hotel (15 minute ride) which has its own docking port for boats. One minute later we were booked in and heading out for a look around. We found a fantastic restaurant just three minutes from the hotel (out main door, turn right, over the bridge, right again â‚¬89 for four starters a botlle of wine and four mains All I can say is that if you are going to Venice in most cases its a once in a lifetime trip so make the best of it...Venice is not cheap but we found the hotel above and beyond what we expected. Its romantic, beautifully decorated and superbly appointed...10/10.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clairefbrom
Reviews.Content: The heading says it all, this hotel was fantastic my husband and myself have just come back from a short break there.it is only a 5 mins walk from San Marco our hotel room was on ground floor and when we looked out of our window we looked straight on to the canal, it looked really quaint as you approach hotel there is a little bridge to cross to door into hotel and receiption. the staff were very friendly and helpful the room was great it had plenty of space and was very clean. we took a water bus from the airport which cost us 12 euros each which wasn't to bad but thats where the value for money ends.we paid 8 euros each to go up the tower in st marks square the veiws of venice from here were great but i am not sure they were worth the money when you can get great views from the top of st marks for 4 euros. the veiws from the rialto bridge down the grand canal were breath taking. we took a waterbus from here to san marco which was great and inexpensive at 6 euros. my main gripe about my whole experience in Vience was eating out, most restaurants add 12.5% service charge, i do not mind tipping if i have had good service but do feel that the choice should be mine and not added wether i like it or not. This said there are still lots of places that do not make this charge if you look about. Venice is expensive but you have to allow for the fact that tourisum is the bread and butter for a large amount of them, and Venice is still worth visiting we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Palazzo Priuli in January”
Reviews.Author: peterandanna
Reviews.Content: My son and his wife wanted to surpise me as I was spending my 60th birthday in Venice. We were renting a small apartment near San Marco and they wanted a hotel close by. On Last minute.com they found this hotel and paid Â£390 for 3 nights for a lovely room decorated in Venetian style. The bathroom was large and had a full sized bath. The breakfast was a buffet that offered lots of choice and was open to guests until 11 am. They loved their stay there and in January Venice is reasonably tranquil.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: SpitfireTraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 1 night at the Hotel Palazzo Priuli. The hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Piazza San Marco and a Vaporetto stop. The staff was extremely kind and helpful and spoke fluent English. The hotel decor was old-world and charming. We had reserved a Quad room for (4) people and were upgraded to the Junior Suite, which was large with a huge bathroom. The hotel provided a delicious continental breakfast with many options. It served our purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: CharleenVA
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I loved the Palazzo Priuli! It felt more like an apartment than a hotel. I was a little concerned when we were placed in the annex but it was great! We loved walking up to our room. The beds were comfortable and our bathroom was roomy and spotless. We walked easily to San Marco and quickly learned our way about during our 5 day stay. The hotel helped us with our dinner reservation the first night, but afterwards it was easy to find delicious dining within a short walk of the hotel. My only slight dislike was the water taxi. It was a little disconcerting getting let off in the middle of lunch service at a restaurant. I would definitely stay here again, but next time call from the airport to have a porter meet us.

Reviews.Title: “Full of character”
Reviews.Author: CaspianCaversham
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Priuli is a great place to stay, centrally located but just far enough from san Marco to avoid the late night noise, other than the singing from the Gondolas which pass under some windows. Be careful though that you are not deceived by some websites which show pictures of the Palazzo but book you into the sister hotels (annexes) of the Nicolo Priuli and the Ca Priuli. The location is still great, but these are ordinary buildings, not a Palazzo. Donâ€™t expect big hotel 4 star features. There are only 11 rooms, so this cannot sustain a bar or piano player. The stairs are very well worn and there is no lift, but the place is full of character and the rooms are well equipped and spacious, despite having had decent size modern bathrooms carved out of them. The aircon was very effective in our room 106. Sadly, a TV was provided where we would much sooner have had tea making facilities. We booked well in advance and paid 7500 airmiles, about Â£450, for 4 nights, including a decent buffet breakfast in the super dining hall. Finding this hotel can be a problem. Get a good map first thing you arrive, or better still before you go. Ours came with the (British) AA city pack at Â£7. The hotel is located immediately north of S. Zaccaria and San Provolo canal. Take a look at the pictures on the website beforehand, because thereâ€™s nothing to tell you that you are in the right place till you step in the door! If travelling by the public waterbus â€˜Alilungaâ€™ go straight in from the S. Zaccaria stop. Itâ€™s more of a hike from San Marco. Eating in Venice is tricky. There are endless open air places offering â€˜tourist menuâ€™ but only go for this if you eat to live, rather than vice versa. If you like the location, or have left it late, this may be your only option. If good food is your goal, best seek out the back street trattorias where the Venetians go. Very near the Priuli is the Al Giardine. A short walk but well hidden in calle del pestrin is the Corte Sconte, slightly touristy but excellent service and seafood and in all the guidebooks but expect to end up shelling out Â£50 per head. For a decent lunch try Osteria al Mascaron, nearby at calle lunga Santa Maria Formosa. Further afield and to escape other tourists altogether try the much cheaper and less pretentious Al Cacciatori by Ponte Piccolo near the Santa Eufemia vaporetti stop on Giudecca island. Similar is the Al Cugnai on Piscina Forner near the Academia, family run and headed by the apparently famous crones, one of whom seemed to take a shine to us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo Priuli”
Reviews.Author: Eva9
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this lovely Palazzo. We had room 103 which was large and beautifully appointed. We particularly liked the fact that the bedroom window faced the Fondemente which was good for people watching, and the bathroom window was above the canal which had numerous gondolas traveling by with tourists. The breakfast was more than adequate - croissants, breads, fruit, ham and cheese, cererals etc. It is served in one half of a large salon, the second half serving as a parlor/sitting room. In the afternoon, wine is set out on the serving table. The staff was also very friendly and always helpful. While a porter did take our bags up to our room, the steps are very steep and, of course, there is no elevator. The location is also ideal. Just minutes from San Marco, and while a busy little area, not nearly as busy as San Marco itself. I really did love everything about this place and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tellsie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Priuli for 5 nights in February. We stayed in the annex of the hotel which is just at the end of the short street from the main building with its own entrance. We actually preferred it. It was amazingly quiet and everyday there was a fresh large bouquet of flowers in the landing. Our room was on the small side but cozy and nice. It had two large windows that overlooked the street. There was a small hallway with large closet that connected to the bathroom which was new and very clean with a window that overlooked a courtyard. We had a dresser of 4 drawers in our room plus the closet so clothing space was fine. One thing... they could really use a shelving unit or something in the bathroom- there's absolutely nowhere to put toiletries, which was quite annoying. Other features: well stocked fairly cheap mini bar, small television with cable, queensize heavy wooden bed and lovely furnishings. Breakfast was standard euro breakfast fare. It was fine. Mostly we just drank cappuchinos and had some bread and headed out to sightsee in Venice. The location is amazing. Our friends from Treviso recommended the area around Priuli specifically. They said it was the "grandparents" area, which was very quiet but close to the excitement. It was totally true. It was perfect and we are a couple of thirtysomethings. It wasn't hard to find for us at all- it's quite easy, just look at the map. It's the stop before San Marco on the water taxi and you walk down the street almost directly in front of the water taxi stop. My husband and I look forward to our next trip to Venice, we will definitely be staying at the Priuli again.

Reviews.Title: “One slight drawback”
Reviews.Author: Northbrook
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel after comparing reviews for venice on TripAdvisor as we thought the location would be good - and it was, nice quiet setting but near shops and restaurants, one minute from the San Zaccaria waterbus stops on the canal front and two minutes to Palazzo San Marco. We were late arriving but there was no fuss, a pleasant welcome and the room was spacious, with a huge bathroom compared to more modern hotels. The room was on the first floor and overlooked a side canal and had a magnificent oak-beamed ceiling. However, we learned early next morning of its drawback - right next to the small breakfast kitchen so from an early hour there was the clattering and background noise of food preparation and dishes. Be warned if you are given room 104! Otherwise we were very pleased with the hotel, the breakfasts were fine and we loved the elegance of the eating area with its magnificent chandelier that was left lit at night - looked wonderful from the other side of the canal. We would probably stay here again given the handiness of its location but I would ask for a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Silver Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: BlondePond
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect spot for a romantic break. We spent four nights here celebrating our Silver Wedding anniversary last September. Although it took us a while to find the hotel initially, we were very pleased when we did, it looks stunning and is down a quiet backwater away from the tourist areas. The reception staff were very efficient and spoke perfect English. We had a ground floor room just off reception which we thought at first may be noisy, but it wasn't. Our window looked out onto the front canal and in the mornings with the windows opened we could hear the excited chatter of Italian children walking to school opposite, a taste of the real Italy. Breakfast was served on the first floor, up a marble staircase which has slightly shifted over the years and has a quirky slope at the top - it just made everything very authentic. The food was freshly laid out and there was a good selection for a continental breakfast. Although the hotel is situatied a few minutes from St Marks square, to us this was preferable to being on the over populated tourist streets which seemed very loud at all hours, especially with the shops being open until late into the evening. On our actual anniversary we had a gondolier take us from the hotel to our restaurant on the edge of the lagoon, he serenaded us along the way and it was just a magical experience - apart from when he hummed what seemed to be the Crazy Frog, which was quite amusing! We booked our stay through airmiles, and everything went without a hitch. We would definitely stay here again. The weather in September was warm but not too hot, and we didn't have any rain or flooding which sometimes happens in St Mark's square in the winter months. If you go to Venice, you simply MUST go to the fish market on Wednesday which is just off the Rialto Bridge, we had never seen a display like it! Top rate.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Gem Tucked away!!”
Reviews.Author: tfdiva
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through a travel agent at the last minute to go to the Venice Carnival. It did take some time to get from the train station to the hotel stop via the ferry, but it was a nice hotel. It is not far from Piazza San Marco tucked away over a small bridge down a narrow alley. It is hard to find and the bell hop was very nice and rescued me from a nearby piazza even taking my bags for me!! The hotel is Old, but very tastefully decorated with period furnishings. I could tell my room had been renovated, but it still had the charm of an old Palace. The staff was very nice and helpful. It is a 15-20 minute walk to get to the "popular" area around Rialto Bridge, but it is a very quiet location. I have friends that stayed in the "popular" area and they did not get a wink of sleep due to all the parties. In my room, I did not hear a sound!! I would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: tricjghe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palazzo Priuli for 3 nights at the beginning of November. I had researched comments made, on tripadvisor, for all 4* hotels within easy reach of St Marc's Square and found a few that had excellent overall reviews. I was also looking at price so the Priuli came out on all top. We were dropped at the end of the canal and only found the hotel by chance as I nearly tripped over the door mat. Many buildings are difficult to find as they don't have any outside signage. The hotel is an historical Venetian buildings with original fittings and lovely chandeliers. The room we had, 106 was exactly like the photos, as small double room. As it was on the side canal, which in narrow, the opposite buildings were quite near which made the room quite dark. This was not a problem as were not in the room much and the evening were dark. In the summer it would probably be a bonus and be cool. It had good storage, lots of hangers. Clean crisp bedding (bed was very hard). Beautiful bathroom with clean linen and adequate toiletries. Take a kettle if you want to make a drink, there is a mini bar fridge. The staff speak excellent English and were very helpful in everything we aked them. Breakfast was excellent, fresh and lots of choice. Although don't expect a full English. The hotel is 3 minutes from the water bus stop, 5 minutes from St Marc's Square and from there it is easy to get anywhere. Be prepared for lots of walking. The only thing I would like to point out is that don't expect usual 4* hotel. There is a small area that has newspapers and 2 comfy sofas but is is not really like the lounge are expected. There is no bar or outside area. However it is beautyfully kept with all the history icludedand not the price of the Bauer etc. On arrival we took a water taxi from the airport (100 Euros) as recommended by friends who had been before, who stayed near Rialto Bridge. Although it was quick, unless you can find someone to share the cost (ask at the landing stage, lots of people were waiting for the water bus and may have shared the cost of the taxi as it holds about 12 people), I wouldn't bother again as The Priuli is situated before you get to St Marc's Square and the Grand Canal so you don't get to see the sights. You could ask the taxi driver to take you on a round trip before dropping you at the hotel . I recommend taking a round trip on a waterbus instead or spend the money on a water taxi to take you to the places you want to see.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recomend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to Italy, we did all of our own bookings and could not have been more happy with our choice of hotel in Venice. We stayed in the annex building named Ca Priuli. We were intially comparing to USA hotel style stays but as we embraced the city of Venice we realized how great our hotel was. Certainly offers great location, great staff, very clean and nice breakfast. Consider this location for your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dd10082005
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with perfect conceirge and staff services. Breakfast was to die for. Good location. Would stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “There are better choices for the money in Venice”
Reviews.Author: nwwriter
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised with all the high ratings of this hotel, or, perhaps we were in the worst room they have. We researched many hotels in Venice and based on all the ratings and the web page we decided this looked to be the hotel to give us the most atmosphere to start our long European vacation and the best feeling of Venice. We were very disappointed at the room we were given, a main floor room with the single small window facing the back at the utility area. The room was small, narrow, stuffy, cramped, and very dark. Air conditioning barely worked. The cloth wall paper appeared to be covering many holes in the walls as when we leaned on the wall our hands would push the cloth into the wall. Breakfast was fairly good though, and the location is great. Additionally, this isn't a cheap hotel. Their rates are on the higher end comparably with other hotels in Venice. Their premiere rooms must be what they show on their web site because our room was nothing like their web page shows. For the price, there are far better choices in Venice. We were very disappointed. Fortunately, Venice is a wonderful city so we spent little time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ... but a costly lesson learned about cancellations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great. A little difficult to find the hotel even with a map. Learned from Hotel Priuli a very expensive travel lesson concerning room reservation cancellation. Make sure you get the correct cancellation policy. The hotel staff quoted one policy and the booking agency had been given another by the hotel. Secondly, don't count on assistance from VISA in contesting the charges if you don't have a cancellation confirmation number. Of course it's a mute point when the hotel refuses to honor your reservation request as this hotel did, stating that we were too late. We weren't according to the policy sent us by the booking agent. The loss we incurred was almost $750 US dollars. Repeated emails to the hotel went unacknowledged. Finally, a phone coversation with hotel management took place in March of 2006. Their resolution offer; a free nights stay at Hotel Priuli if we should return to Italy anytime in 2006-2007!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bu;ilding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Priuli is a wonderful building in a lovely location - almost a backwater but very pretty and close to unusual shops and central to major sights. Our accommodation was splendid and very spacious - a back corner suite with a view over a quiet canal. The bathroom was superb but the bedrooms (two) lacked something - mainly somewhere comfortable to sit. The rooms were very large but the one chair was solid wood so we could only sit on the bed. Breakfast was good but the small breakfast room was always crowded with not much space between tables. Guests staying in the annexe often arrived for breakfast laden with coats or umbrellas with no-where to put them and this further cramped the breakfast space. The hotel lacks features such as a bar, coffee or tea making facilities or somewhere to sit or relax, especially after a hard days walking. Take your own kettle (or drinks)! The lack of a lounge meant that we hardly spoke to other guests and it was not easy to meet others. Staff were friendly and helpful and would always recommend restaurants that were good or walking areas that were interesting. There was a good stock of maps and literature. I don't know whether we would return to this particular hotel although it really was beautiful with some features that were very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bysshe98
Reviews.Content: Just got around to doing this. We asked and paid in advance for a room in the main building with a view of the canal. Initially they gave us a room on the first floor at the back of the hotel with a view of a brick wall and an 18" gap through which there was water flowing so you could argue I suppose that it was a canal...we rejected it immediately and was given a choice of 2 beautiful rooms on the other side of the first floor overlooking a proper canal and some shops. Absoultely great...staff were super but slightly aloof and the location was perfect a peaceful oasis just behind St Marks....3 or 4 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lillia
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again! I have been to Venice on several occasions and this is the best hotel I have stayed in. The room was beautiful AND comfortable - with a great view of the canal. Although Venice was very cold, the temperature in the room was perfect - neither too hot nor too cold. This hotel blends the Venetian look with modern conveniences perfectly. The hotel breakfast was OK - apart from the bread which was pretty rank (unusually for Italy), but improved greatly after some treatment from the sandwich toaster! The hotel location is very good - 5 mins to the vaporetto stop. There is also an excellent bar/restaurant on the way, which not only has lovely staff and delicious food, but also Sky TV!!

Reviews.Title: “14th Century Refinement at the Priuli”
Reviews.Author: Migs
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Palazzo Priuli; it is a 14th century building with 2005 conveniences e.g. air conditioning and totally modern bathroom; our room was on the ground floor of the Palazzo which included these 2005 additions which, surprisingly, did not detract from the original building. The building is in a warm terracotta colour and must be one of the prettiest of its type in Venice - I know it was once the home of a Doge and noticed more than one walking tour stopping outside the building and explaining its history; I tried to listen to one but it was in German so no luck there! Breakfast was served on the first floor in a lovely room with a fine chandelier and typical Venetian furnishings. The buffet was plentiful with cereals, cold meat, cheese, fruit, yoghurt, fruit juices, toast and warm rolls and croissants served at your table. The hotel has no bar or dining facilities but there are plenty of these nearby. It is near enough to St. Mark's but without the constant masses. The staff were all courteous, friendly and helpful and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to explore Venice after reading the reviews on this website. The location is very good if you want to be near St Mark's Square but with some peace and quiet. The area it is situated in is very popular with the local artists. Mainly because the hotel looks picturesque on the canal corner with its own bridge. The route from the water taxi at St Mark's to the hotel is easy if you have a half decent map or a good guidebook such as the DK Eyewitness Guide. It's well sited for exploring Venice and there are some great restaurants nearby. Definitely take a gondola ride at 80 euros,it's worth every cent. Also, there are some nice fish restaurants by the Rialto bridge. My family and I were in the annexe of the hotel and it didn't matter at all. The rooms were clean and reasonably well furnished and have most of the things you expect hotel rooms to have. Eating breakfast in the hotel on the first floor was fine. They provide a good Continental buffet breakfast. The guy at the desk was incredibly snooty but the other staff were fairly affable. Overall, a great location at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: leipzig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Palazzo Priuli in June, 2005 and absolutely loved it. The service is wonderful and so is the location. We were given a room in the annex, without a water view, but upon our request, we were moved the second night to a larger room overlooking the canal (without any extra charges). Breakfast (included in the price) was wonderful, with a nice assortment of bread, cheese, fruit, and Italian sweets -- in a beautiful room, with flowers and detailed wood-beamed ceilings. The hotel is charming without being stuffy, the perfect place to relax and enjoy Venice. There is also a great balcony on the annex which provdes a great viewing angle for photos. We have only praise for this great hotel, which is also a great bargain. We will be back there again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Priuli - comes up trumps!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Priuli makes for a great holiday. Good value for money, great breakfast, good furnishings and best of all, a great location. There are two parts to the hotel; the old palazzo (palace) and an annexe. The annexe rooms were comfortable, clean and were nicely decorated. It is located fairly near to all the Venice hot-spots and over-all, was a very good experience. I would definitely recommend it and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: LM_Williams
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel, staff were always available and very friendly and helpful. i went expecting a tiny dingy room but was very pleasantly suprised. Location is brilliant, literally less than 5 mins on foot to Marks. If you follow the hotel directions and get off the Water Bus from Marco Polo at the stop BEFORE St Marks, then its only 5 mins from the water and involves only one small bridge - its quite easy to find really. Breakfast was also v good with warm croissants bought to your table whatever time you went to the dining hall. We never found a problem with the seating either. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and it was definately a 4 star by any standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, close to all major tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in late March this year (just before the Easter weekend). We had a wonderful trip and the hotel was excellent. The staff were always helpful and courteous and the decor and ambience of the hotel is terrific. We stayed in an annex of the hotel, but even this was of the same standard. The buffet breakfast was also first class. All in all it was a really good experience.

Reviews.Title: “A back street Palace”
Reviews.Author: covcdeisaraceni
Reviews.Content: Returned from Palazzo Priuili on 17th.March, after a 4 night stay. I didn't come across your website until after I'd made my booking way back in Nov'04. I was so concerned after reading so many of the reviews I was beginning to wonder if I had made a big mistake. I even contacted the hotel to make sure I had a room in the main building. Well all my fears were totally blown away! What was I worrying about? This is a really special hotel with so much history- that marble staircase is well worn! and those beams.We had room 111 on Fondamenta dell'osmarin,spacious and very clean,right next to the breakfast room.I would just like to comment on some of the concerns that some of your reviewers expressed. Location- Alilugana from Marco Polo to San Zaccaria - as you walk off the landing station look directly ahead and you'll see a yellow sign for Chiesa (church)San Zaccaria,follow this, -hotel is less than a 5 min. walk from here. It would be useful to have a street map just to weave your way to the fondamenta. where you will see the side of the hotel (no name until you cross Ponte Diavola, then you see the mat outside the entrance!). You have to look past the hotel to see the street name. Breakfast- typical Continental/European-good quality and choice. Hotel was full and we had no problem with lack of tables. Rating- the only thing I would say that maybe should prevent it being 4star is lack of certain facilities, but what facilities it does have are very good, besides, there is too much to see outside of the hotel to be too concerned about this. Staff-courteous and helpful, always some one available 24hrs a day. I would certainly recommend some research before you go. it will certainly help.I would guess that the bad reviews were a result of no research I would also recommend a direct flight with BA Citi Express--excellent.

Reviews.Title: “hard to find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We could not see the Hotel Palazzo Priuli even tho we were right beside it . It took two locals to find it for us and even they had difficulty. if you go there look for a doormat which says Hotel Palazzo Priuli ! Once we found it we were delighted with what we found, apart from the rather oppressive warm air heating system which gave us headaches when we awoke in the morning. The good points: Very clean Great location near St Marks Pleasant room Nice dining room with good breakfast selection Courteous and helpful staff

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo Priuli
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 4979/b Fondamenta de l'Osmarin, 30122 Venice, Italy
